awd_titl_txt: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2023 IEEE International Conference on Computer Communications (INFOCOM)
awd_abstract_narration:
This project will support students at U.S. institutions to attend the 2023 IEEE International Conference on Computer Communications (INFOCOM) conference, May 17-20 in the New York City area. This student travel support will enable sharing scientific information and stimulating research interests for U.S. based graduate students in the field of communications and networking. Attending IEEE INFOCOM will be highly valuable for graduate students. Not only will they be exposed to the state-of-the-art in the field, but they will also have the opportunity to interact with peers from institutions worldwide, meet with leading researchers, and take part in discussions that are likely to shape the future of the field.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA

por.por_cntn:
This project aims at providing graduate students based in the United States with the opportunity to attend the 2023 IEEE International Conference on Computer Communications (IEEE INFOCOM). The IEEE INFOCOM 2023 was held in New York area from May 17 to 20, 2023. This preeminent technical conference is the primary venue for presenting new research results in the area of computer communications, and is widely attended by leading scientists, researchers, and practitioners from all around the world. With the opportunities of paper presentation, attending panel and keynote sessions, and interacting with hundreds of others performing cutting-edge research in the field, the conference attendance is extremely valuable for the graduate students’ education and long-term career development.

This NSF INFOCOM 2023 student travel grant was used to cover the travel expenses of 20 students from 20 different universities. Among the 20 recipients, there are 7 female students, and 6 first-time attendees.

 

The award amount made to each awardee covers the majority of the travel and registration expenses. About the transportation expense, only US-based carriers were counted. The award amount made to each awardee is around $1,000. The total amount made to all the awardees is $19,985.23. All the NSF fund was used to support the student travel.

 

During the conference, the awardees expressed their deep appreciation for the travel support and acknowledged the great value and importance of attending the conference. They not only learned the state-of-the-art research in the field, participated panel discussions, but also had the opportunities of interacting with peers, meeting new colleagues, and for the students about to graduate, obtaining advices on academic job search. 

 


Last Modified: 01/29/2024
Modified by: Haiyang Wang
